required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Different Teaching- and Learningmethods
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Different Teaching- and Learningmethods Concerning the Humeral Intraosseal Access in Inexperienced Providers

brief_summary.textblock: Due to the corona pandemia and the consecutive reduction of teaching students face to face the imparting of medical skills is limited. Video sequences may be an adequate alternative to educate selected practical skills. The investigators explored this aspect in spring 2021 concerning the humeral intraosseous access. This study was registered under ClinicalTrials: NCT04842357. Data is still under statistical analysis and not published yet. As a secondary endpoint we found participant having done self-study first and watched a teaching-video one week later performed better than participant in the vice versa sequence. This may have important curricular implications. So, we launch the present study to investigate, if the sequence: Self-Study, then Teaching-Video is more efficient than vice versa.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators will recruit last year medical students and randomise them into two groups: Group A and Group B. Group A will watch a standardised video about the skill, then directly do self-study. Group B will do self-study and then directly watch a standardised video. Right after this, both groups will be video recorded during the performance of the skill: humeral intraosseous access on a simulator. The performance will be quantified by a scale by two investigators

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Two unbound samples running through a different sequence of teching-/learningmethods
study_design_info.masking_description: Investigator are blinded/masked against the study arm of the particular assessed participant.

primary_outcome.description: sum of the score used to evaluate the particpants' performance by video records

arm_group.description: Participants first do self-study, then right afterwards watch a teaching video, then become tested on a simulator and are videorecorded for evaluation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Sequence: teaching video, then self study
arm_group.description: Participants first watch a teaching video, then do self-study, then become tested on a simulator and are videorecorded for evaluation

intervention.arm_group_label: Sequence: teaching video, then self study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- voluteer medical students in their last year of medical school (i.e. after 2nd state board in Germany)
- writen informed consert
Exclusion Criteria:
- denial of participation

responsible_party.investigator_title: Thomas Ott, M.D., DESA, Scientific consultant of the simulation center, Department of Anesthesiology, University Hospital Center
